chargeHist.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 10:25 AM Defendant DeShawn D. Lay in court, in custody, with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  City of New Berlin Police Department Officer Jordan Roberts sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Thompson.  Cross examination by Attorney Sonderhouse.  State rests.  State moves for bind over without argument.  Attorney Sonderhouse objects to bind over with argument and moves to dismiss Count 2.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Date shall remain as previously set.  Attorney Sonderhouse would like for it to be put on the record that the defendant just requested for Attorney Sonderhouse to withdraw from the case.  The Court will take note of the defendant's request and Attorney Sonderhouse will follow-up to said request.

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 04/14/22 requesting treatment and resolution of cases.

11:46 AM Defendant DeShawn D. Lay in court, in custody, with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case 22CF276 called to review competency report filed by Dr. Neiss.
The report finds the Defendant competent.
Attorney Sonderhouse is not challenging the doctors report.  Defendant does not wish to challenge the report.
State is not challenging the doctors report.
The Court finds the Defendant competent to proceed.
Case 22CF276 is set for preliminary hearing.
Cases 20CF672 and 21CF71 were set for jury status, but are removed from the trial calendar and set for further proceedings to allow the cases to proceed together. 

Hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 10:15 am.  Hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

08:38 AM Defendant DeShawn D. Lay in court, in custody, with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Hearing on February 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to have no contact with victims A & B/witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.
